DataElement.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Quantity ISO21090.URG.INT.NONNEG.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity defined at a global library level that identifies a characteristic or requirement intended to be applied to a potential study subject to determine whether they may participate in a study. EXAMPLE(S): Must be over the age of 18. The number of times the activity occurs. NOTE(S): If the frequency is more than once a day, this is still interpreted per time, e.g. BID for 5 days = 10 repeats.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Repeat Quantity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Make or do or perform again.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Exclusion Criteria Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Make or do or perform again.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

Concepts.definition: Make or do or perform again.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval. mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains URG so that the values are non-negative integers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
